Takeda Shingen
The great mountains of your home beckon to you, Lord Harunobu, ruler of the proud Takeda. Your people may be rightly known for their skill when in the saddle, but every man in Japan’s heartland fears the Takeda for their unarmed lethality and effective domain control in equal measure. Take on the mantle of Shingen, O great daimyo, and be as the wind, as a forest, as fire, and as a mountain.
Ah, this is a good day! I look forward to the day when we ride together out from the mountains.
Hmm… No, this will not do. Apologies.
We should declare our friendship to all the other powers in this world. There is no reason for the Takeda to fight you.
Many thanks for your acceptance! Perhaps we can continue making arrangements elsewhere?
Ah… Perhaps it was just my fevered hope.
I am afraid that there can only be one victor in this age of warring states. That victor will be the Takeda, and I must make sure of it.
Your lands will make a fine addition to the Takeda empire, like Shinano before you.
I leave my relatives in control of my armies for one second, and this happens? I should have known better. You deserve your victory.
We accept your delegation. I shall send some of my men out to guide them through the mountain passes.
What, and give you the secrets of the arts of the Takeda warriors? You must be joking.
It is hard to grow rice in our lands, so we cannot send as rich a gift as others might. But, please accept this hoto and soba, and our delegation with it.
You are nothing but an errant estate owner in the way of the Takeda.
What is it this time? Just because you have a coastline doesn’t mean you’re a match for the Takeda.
The people of Kai and Shinano welcome you, stranger. I am Daimyo Takeda Shingen, ruler of all under Mount Fuji. Tell me, which lands are yours?
Please, come with me to Kai! We have mANY" Language="en_US"> wonderful hot springs hidden away in our mountains.
You have our thanks.
